00047 // Platform Sniffing

00049 // We need to figure out what OS and compiler is being used.
00050 // This will result in symbols being set for conditional compiling of things like memory allocation.
00051 
00052 // First Check for symbols defined by the Max API
00053 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00054         #define TAPTOOLS_TARGET_MAC 1
00055 #elif defined(WIN_VERSION)
00056         #define TAPTOOLS_TARGET_WIN 1
00057 #elif defined(WIN32)            // Next look for something commonly defined by VC++ to see whether we're on Windows.
00058         #define TAPTOOLS_TARGET_WIN 1
00059 //#else                                         // If all else fails, assume we are on the Mac...
00060 //      #define TAPTOOLS_TARGET_MAC 1
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 
00064 // Include the appropriate API header
00065 #if TARGET_OS_WIN                               // Windows

00075 // Specification of our base class
00076 class tt_audio_base{
00077         private:
00078                 bool                                    is_initialized;                         // Flag set by successful initialization
00079                 
00080                 void init();                                                                            // Initialization - used by the constructors
00081 
00082         protected:
00083                 int                                     sr;                                                     // This object's sample rate
00084                 double                                  r_sr;                                           // reciprocal of sr
00085                 float                                   m_sr;                                           // sr * 0.001
00086                 static int                              global_sr;                                      // Global sample rate
00087                 static int                              global_vectorsize;
00088                 static const float              lookup_equalpower[];            // Equal Power lookup table
00089                 static const float              lookup_half_paddedwelch[];      // 256 point window table (the first half of it)
00090 
00091                 static const float              lookup_quartersine[];           // Quarter Sine lookup table
00092                 static const double     twopi;                                          // 6.28...
00093                 static const double     anti_denormal_value;            // Used by the anti_denormal functions
00094                 int                                             temp_vs;                                        // Temporary variable for use in vector routines
00095                 
00096         public:
00097                 static const double     pi;                                                     // 3.14...
00098                 int                                             vectorsize;                             // Made Public for Speed (Fast access in dsp routines)
00099                 
00100                 // OBJECT LIFE
00101                 tt_audio_base();                                                                // constructor
00102                 ~tt_audio_base();                                                               // destructor - free memory, etc.

00106                 static void set_global_sr(int value);                   // sets the global sample rate for the library
00107                 static int get_global_sr();                                             // return the global sample rate
00108                 void set_sr(int value);                                                 // sets the local sample rate for the object
00109                 int get_sr();                                                                   // return the local sample rate

00117                 // Attempt to knock out denormalized floats; inlined here for speed
00118                 static double anti_denormal(double value)
00119                 {
00120                 #ifndef TT_DISABLE_DENORMAL_FIX         // Define this to test code without denormal fixing
00121                         value += anti_denormal_value;
00122                         value -= anti_denormal_value;
00123                 #endif
00124                         return(value);
00125                 }

00138                 // UTILITIES (all inlined here for speed)
00139 
00140                 // clip utility
00141                 template<class T>
00142                 static T clip(T value, T low_bound, T high_bound)
00143                 {
00144                         // This version used branching
00145                         // return value < low_bound? low_bound: (value > high_bound? high_bound : value);
00146                         
00147                         // This version doesn't (!)
00148                         /* This also takes care of denormal number elimination - see the original post
00149                                         to music-dsp by Laurent de Soras (and the appended comments)
00150                            While this looks more complex, it actually _is_ faster
00151                            This also applies to the min_limit and max_limit functions
00152                          */
00153 
00154                         // VC++ SEEMS TO HAVE MENTAL ISSUES, HENCE THE DUMB HACK BELOW...
00155 //#ifdef WIN_VERSION
00156 //                      float x1 = fabs((float)(value - low_bound));
00157 //                      float x2 = fabs((float)(value - high_bound));
00158 //#else
00159 //                      T x1 = fabs(value - low_bound);
00160 //                      T x2 = fabs(value - high_bound);
00161 //#endif // WIN_VERSION
00162 //                      value = x1 + (low_bound + high_bound);
00163 //                      value -= x2;
00164 //                      value *= 0.5;
00165 
00166 // Re-written here as a one-liner:              
00167 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00168                         value = T(((fabs(value - low_bound)) + (low_bound + high_bound)) - fabs(value - high_bound));
00169 #else   // VC++ gens an ERROR because of the ambiguous call to fabs().  This is annoying...
00170                         value = T(((fabs(double(value - low_bound))) + (low_bound + high_bound)) - fabs(double(value - high_bound)));
00171 #endif
00172                         value /= 2;             // relying on the compiler to optimize this, chosen to reduce compiler errors in Xcode
00173                         return value;
00174                 }
00175                 
00176                 template<class T>
00177                 static T limit_max(T value, T high_bound)
00178                 {
00179                         value = high_bound - value;
00180 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00181                         value += fabs(value);
00182 #else
00183                         value += fabs((double)value);
00184 #endif
00185                         value *= 0.5;
00186                         value = high_bound - value;
00187                         return value; 
00188                 }
00189                 
00190                 template<class T>
00191                 static T limit_min(T value, T low_bound)
00192                 {
00193                         value -= low_bound;
00194 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00195                         value += fabs(value);
00196 #else
00197                         value += fabs((double)value);
00198 #endif
00199                         value *= 0.5;
00200                         value += low_bound;
00201                         return value; 
00202                 }
00203                 
00204                 
00205                 // round utility
00206                 static long round(float value)
00207                 {
00208                         if(value > 0)
00209                                 return((long)(value + 0.5));
00210                         else
00211                                 return((long)(value - 0.5));
00212                 }
00213                 static long round(double value)
00214                 {
00215                         if(value > 0)
00216                                 return((long)(value + 0.5));
00217                         else
00218                                 return((long)(value - 0.5));
00219                 }
00220                 
00221                 // onewrap utility
00222                 template<class T>
00223                 static T onewrap(T value, T low_bound, T high_bound)
00224                 {
00225                         if((value >= low_bound) && (value < high_bound)) 
00226                                 return value;
00227                         else if(value >= high_bound)
00228                                 return((low_bound - 1) + (value - high_bound)); 
00229                         else
00230                                 return((high_bound + 1) - (low_bound - value));
00231                 }
00232                 
00233                 // scale utility
00234                 template<class T>
00235                 T scale(T value, T inlow, T inhigh, T outlow, T outhigh)
00236                 {
00237                         double inscale, outdiff;
00238                          
00239                         inscale = 1 / (inhigh - inlow);
00240                         outdiff = outhigh - outlow;
00241                         
00242                         value = (value - inlow) * inscale;
00243                         value = (value * outdiff) + outlow;
00244                         return(value);                                                                                  
00245                 }
00246 
00247                 
00248                 // RADIANS CONVERSIONS: cannot make static because of access to a member data element
00249                 // hz-to-radians conversion
00250                 double hertz_to_radians(double hz)      // NOTE: Be sure to set the sr before calling this function
00251                 {
00252                         return(hz * (pi / (sr * 0.5)));
00253                 }
00254 
00255                 // radians-to-hz conversion
00256                 double radians_to_hertz(double radians) // NOTE: Be sure to set the sr before calling this function
00257                 {
00258                         return((radians * sr) / twopi);
00259                 }
00260 
00261                 // degrees-to-radians conversion
00262                 double degrees_to_radians(double degrees)
00263                 {
00264                         return((degrees * pi) / 180.);
00265                 }
00266 
00267                 // radians-to-degrees conversion
00268                 double radians_to_degrees(double radians)
00269                 {
00270                         return((radians * 180.) / pi);  
00271                 }

00274                 // Decay Time (seconds) to feedback coefficient conversion
00275                 static float decay_to_feedback(float decay_time, float delay)
00276                 {
00277                         float   fb;                                     // variable for our result              
00278                         delay = delay * 0.001;          // convert delay from milliseconds to seconds
00279                         if(decay_time < 0){
00280                                 fb = delay / -decay_time;
00281                                 fb = fb * -60.;         
00282                                 fb = pow(10., (fb / 20.));      
00283                                 fb *= -1.;
00284                         }
00285                         else{
00286                                 fb = delay / decay_time;
00287                                 fb = fb * -60.;                         
00288                                 fb = pow(10., (fb / 20.));              
00289                         }               
00290                         return(fb);                     
00291                 }
00292 
00293                 // return the decay time based on the feedback coefficient
00294                 static float feedback_to_decay(float feedback, float delay)
00295                 {
00296                         float   decay_time;                             // variable for our result
00297                         
00298                         if(feedback > 0){
00299                                 decay_time = 20. * (log10(feedback));           
00300                                 decay_time = -60.0 / decay_time;                
00301                                 decay_time = decay_time * (delay);              
00302                         }
00303                         else if(feedback < 0){
00304                                 decay_time = 20. * (log10(fabs(feedback)));             
00305                                 decay_time = -60.0 / decay_time;                
00306                                 decay_time = decay_time * (-delay);             
00307                         }
00308                         else
00309                                 decay_time = 0;
00310 
00311                         return(decay_time);
00312                 }
00313 
00314 
00315                 // ************* DECIBEL CONVERSIONS **************
00316 
00317                 // Amplitude to decibels
00318                 static float amplitude_to_decibels(float value)
00319                 {
00320                         if (value >= 0) return(20. * (log10(value)));
00321                         else return 0;
00322                 }
00323 
00324                 // Decibels to amplitude
00325                 static float decibels_to_amplitude(float value)
00326                 {
00327                         return(pow(10., (value / 20.)));
00328                 }
00329 
00330                 // Decibels to millimeters
00331                 static float decibels_to_millimeters(float value)
00332                 {
00333                         if (value >= 10.)
00334                                 value = 0.; 
00335                         else if (value > -10.) 
00336                                 value = -12./5. * (value - 10.);
00337                         else if (value > -40.)
00338                                 value = 48. - 12./10. * (value + 10.);
00339                         else if (value > -60.)
00340                                 value = 84. - 12./20. * (value + 40.);
00341                         else if (value > -200.)
00342                                 value = 96. - 1./35. * (value + 60.);
00343                         else value = 100.; 
00344                         value = 100. - value; 
00345 
00346                         return(value);
00347                 }
00348 
00349                 // Decibels to millimeters
00350                 static float millimeters_to_decibels(float value)
00351                 {
00352                         if (value <= 0.) 
00353                                 value = -200.0;
00354                         else if (value < 4.0)
00355                                 value = -60. - 35. * (-(value - 100) - 96.); 
00356                         else if (value < 16.)
00357                                 value = -40. - 20./12. * (-(value - 100) - 84.); 
00358                         else if (value < 52.)
00359                                 value = -10. - 10./12. * (-(value - 100) - 48.);
00360                         else if (value < 100.)
00361                                 value = 10.0 - 5.0/12.0 * -(value - 100);       
00362                         else value = 10.0; 
00363                         
00364                         return(value);
00365                 }
00366                 
00367                 // Millimeters to amplitude
00368                 static float millimeters_to_amplitude(float value)
00369                 {
00370                         value = millimeters_to_decibels(value);
00371                         return decibels_to_amplitude(value);
00372                 }
00373                 
00374                 // Amplitude to millimeters
00375                 static float amplitude_to_millimeters(float value)
00376                 {
00377                         value = amplitude_to_decibels(value);
00378                         return decibels_to_millimeters(value);
00379                 }
00380 
00381 
00382                 // extended MIDI units to decibels (127 = unity gain)
00383                 static float xmidi_to_decibels(float value)
00384                 {
00385                         return (value - 127) * 0.6;
00386                 }
00387                 
00388                 // decibels to extended MIDI units  (127 = unity gain)
00389                 static float decibels_to_xmidi(float value)
00390                 {
00391                         return (value * 1.66666667) + 127;
00392                 }
00393                 
00394                 
00395 
00396                 // ************* MISC STUFF **************
00397                 
00398                 // Deviate
00399                 float deviate(float value)
00400                 {
00401                         value += (2.0 * (float(rand()) / float(RAND_MAX))) - 1.0;       // randomize input with +1 to -1 ms
00402                         value = value * 0.001 * sr;                                                                     // convert from ms to samples
00403                         value = (float)prime(long(value));                                                                              // find the nearest prime number (in samples)
00404                         value = (value / sr) * 1000.0;                                                          // convert back to ms
00405                         
00406                         return value;
00407                 }
00408 
00409                 // Prime
00410                 static long prime(long value)
00411                 {
00412                         long    candidate, last, i, isPrime;
00413 
00414                         if(value < 2)
00415                                 candidate = 2;
00416                         else if(value == 2)
00417                                 candidate = 3;
00418                         else{
00419                                 candidate = value;
00420                                 if (candidate % 2 == 0)                                                 // Test only odd numbers
00421                                         candidate--;
00422                                 do{
00423                                         isPrime = true;                                                         // Assume glorious success
00424                                         candidate += 2;                                         // Bump to the next number to test
00425                                         last = long(sqrt((float)candidate));                                    // We'll check to see if candidate has any factors, from 2 to last
00426                                         for (i=3; (i <= last) && isPrime; i+=2){        // Loop through odd numbers only
00427                                                 if((candidate % i) == 0)
00428                                                 isPrime = false;
00429                                         }
00430                                 } 
00431                                 while (!isPrime);
00432                         }
00433                         return candidate;
00434                 }
